New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run and stole his 48th base, moving closer to becoming the first player in major league history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Tommy Edman homered from both sides of the plate in the same game for the first time.
Key Match Events: Gavin Lux singled in the go-ahead run with two outs in the seventh inning.
Shohei Ohtani hit a home run and stole a base.
Tommy Edman hit a two-out, two-run home run in the eighth inning.
Cody Bellinger hit a three-run home run in the fifth inning.
Michael Kopech loaded the bases on consecutive walks in the ninth inning.
Isaac Paredes hit a sacrifice fly to cut Chicago's deficit to 10-8.
Michael Busch struck out swinging to end the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy commented on the team's resilience, saying, 'We had guys battling up there and it was good to see everyone not giving up.'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Tommy Edman, saying, 'Tommy is otherworldly these days.'
Shohei Ohtani's performance was highlighted by Max Muncy, who said, 'Every night I feel like he does something that we haven’t seen.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller.
The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games of the series.
The Dodgers' magic number to clinch the division dropped to 11 after San Diego lost at Seattle.
The game featured a pitch-clock violation by Michael Kopech.
Others: Cubs' RHP Porter Hodge was cleared by a doctor after experiencing a racing heartbeat.
Dodgers' RHP Tyler Glasnow will throw at least two innings during a simulated game in Atlanta.
Dodgers' RHP Joe Kelly will pitch for Triple-A Oklahoma City before rejoining the team next week.
